DOC.brief_title: Assessment Socioeconomic Status Brazil Quality Life Urinary Incontinence Brazilian Women
DOC.detailed_description: The research conduct Department Gynecology referral hospital state Ceará , Brazil period October 2011 February 2012 . Women refer Primary Care Health schedule evaluation sector Urogynecology Cesar Cals General Hospital , Department Health State Ceará . During study period 200 patient treated complaint urinary incontinence pelvic organ prolapse sector . Included study woman postmenopausal , take hormone therapy last six month . Women urinary loss , non-inhibited contraction detrusor proven urodynamic study . Will compare group woman without pelvic floor dysfunction confirm clinical history gynecological examination characteristic relation postmenopausal status , general gynecology outpatient clinic . Will use data collection socioeconomics interview administrate questionnaire adapt Brazil Economic Classification Criterion - 2011 ( CCEB ) The CCEB instrument economic segmentation use survey household characteristic ( presence quantity item comfort home schooling level household head ) differentiate population . The criterion assign point accord household characteristic performs sum point . Then make match score test strip layer economic status define A1 , A2 , B1 , B2 , C1 , C2 , D , E. This criterion design define broad class meet needs segmentation ( purchase power ) company . To evaluate Quality Life Urinary incontinence pelvic organ prolapse woman use KHQ questionnaire , QoL-P respectively . To evaluate Overall Quality Life , SF-36 . For functional evaluation pelvic floor ( AP ) bidigital evaluation perform use classification Ortiz ( 1996 ) schema PERFECT Oxford ( 1990 ) . Will use application EpiInfo version 6.04 , Atlanta , USA . Will study socioeconomic variable ( age , educational level , economic status income ) , health perception variable ( impact incontinence / prolapse , limitation performance task , physical limitation , social limitation , personal relationship , emotion , sleep energy gravity measurement ) . Will use prevalence urinary incontinence measure occurrence chi-square test test Pearson evaluate statistical significance consider p < 0.05 . Exploratory analysis also perform describe frequency distribution socioeconomic variable .
DOC.criteria: postmenopausal woman clinical diagnosis urinary incontinence / pelvic organ prolapse without contraction uninhibited detrusor cognitive deficit presence uninhibited detrusor contraction
